summary: This is a legal document titled 'Plaintiff's First Set of Interrogatories to Defendant Ghislaine Maxwell' filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York (Case No. 15-cv-07433-RWS). The plaintiff's attorneys, led by Sigrid McCawley, propound 32 detailed interrogatories to Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking information about her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, her knowledge of and involvement in his activities, her financial dealings with him, and her public statements. The document includes extensive definitions and instructions for discovery.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil case, to whom the interrogatories are directed. The questions seek information about her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, her knowledge of his activities, her own actions, and her financial dealings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Defined broadly in the document to include him and any entities he controlled. The interrogatories extensively probe Maxwell's relationship with him, including financial transactions, her role in procuring individuals (specifically for massages), and her knowledge of his activities.

persons.name: Ross Gow
persons.context: Identified as the person who issued a public statement on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell in January 2015. Interrogatory 2 asks about actions Maxwell took regarding this statement.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Lead attorney for the plaintiff who signed and filed the interrogatories. She is with the law firm Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Named as an attorney for the plaintiff from Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP, with an office in Armonk, NY.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Named as an attorney for the plaintiff from the firm Farmer, Jaffe, Weissing, Edwards, Fistos & Lehrman, P.L.

persons.name: Paul G. Cassell
persons.context: Named as an attorney for the plaintiff from the S.J. Quinney College of Law at the University of Utah.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Identified as counsel of record for the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, from the firm Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Identified as counsel of record for the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, from the firm Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Meredith Schultz
persons.context: Named as an attorney for the plaintiff from Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP.

connections.description: The interrogatories seek detailed information about financial transactions (loans, payments) from Epstein to Maxwell, her role in finding individuals to give him massages, and her general involvement with him and his properties.
Gow is identified as having issued a public statement on Maxwell's behalf in January 2015, indicating he was acting as her agent or spokesperson.
McCawley is the lead attorney for the plaintiff propounding interrogatories to the defendant, Maxwell.
Menninger is listed as counsel of record for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Pagliuca is listed as counsel of record for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Ross Gow's Public Statement
events.description: A statement was issued to the public by Ross Gow on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell. The interrogatories ask about Maxwell's actions to retract or clarify this statement.

events.title: Scheduled Deposition in Epstein Civil Suit
events.description: A deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled in a sexual assault civil suit filed against Jeffrey Epstein, which she failed to appear for. Interrogatory 25 asks for all reasons for this failure.

events.title: Relevant Period for Allegations
events.description: The document defines the 'Relevant Period' for the interrogatories as July 1999 to the present, with specific questions about activities and knowledge during 1999-2002.

events.title: Filing of Interrogatories
events.description: The date the Plaintiff's First Set of Interrogatories was filed with the court and served on defense counsel.

locations: Southern District of New York (Court jurisdiction)
Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301 (Law office of Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP)
New York City mansion (Jeffrey Epstein's property)
Armonk, NY 10504 (Law office of David Boies)
Denver, Colorado 80203 (Law office of Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C.)
Salt Lake City, UT 84112 (University of Utah law school)
keyFacts: The interrogatories seek detailed information about financial transfers and loans from Jeffrey Epstein to Ghislaine Maxwell from 1992 to the present (2016).

Multiple interrogatories focus on Maxwell's role in 'recruiting, finding, hiring, introducing, procuring, or otherwise obtaining' females, particularly non-licensed massage therapists, for the purpose of having them perform massages on Jeffrey Epstein.

The plaintiff asks Maxwell to identify all girls under the age of 18 with whom she interacted at Epstein's properties and all persons who told her Epstein had sexual interactions with persons under 18.
The document references a prior instance where Maxwell failed to appear for a deposition scheduled around 2009-2010 in a separate civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein.

The interrogatories probe Maxwell's public statements and legal defenses, including a January 2015 statement issued by her agent, Ross Gow, and her contention that the plaintiff's claims are barred by the UK's Defamation Act of 2013.
